name: Sankalp India Foundation
briefDescription: Sankalp India Foundation is a voluntary blood donation organization that is working for the cause of blood since its birth on 23 May, 2003. Sankalp is registered under the Karnataka Societies Registration Act, 1960. Sankalp runs a 24*7 blood helpline for Karnataka and helps people get access to safe blood in all emergency situations.  Thousands of people have benefited from this service. Sankalp runs 3 Thalassemia day care centers in Karnataka where 700+ children get systematic care and treatment. These children are patients who do not produce red cells and depend upon periodic blood transfusions for life. Sankalp also works for thalassemia cure through it's associated Bone Marrow Transplant units in Bangalore, Mumbai and Ahmedabad Sankalp also conducts voluntary blood donation drives all across the state. Sankalp has organized more than 920+ drives in Karnataka, in colleges and software companies, with over 82000 units of blood being collected by the most prominent, safe and quality focused blood banks.
